title: 【その１】チルラジオ配信 #狐族密会　「あの頃は良かったな、と思った瞬間」【ホロライブ/白上フブキ/尾丸ポルカ】
name: Shirakami Fubuki

entries.text: I just came up with this around this morning.
Just because I wanted to talk to Polka, I set it up on my own, decided the hashtag on my own, and started this "Fox Tribe Secret Meeting Part 1" on my own.
When I woke up, everything was already done.
Yeah, I woke up and everything had advanced on its own, so I figured we're doing this.
The moment I got an "Okay, let's do it" from Polka, I moved everything forward.
Everything was ready, so it's all good. Wonderful.
That might be true. We might be geniuses.
Why? Why? Just admit it! Admit it!
I haven't tweeted that we started.
I won't tweet that we started.
We've started. I'll tweet it now.
It's exclusive to the site, so "Fox Tribe Secret Meeting Part 1" is...
Praising me won't produce anything, you know.
Nothing comes out? Come on, give me something.
Fine, I'll put something out. Have a chocolate.
You said you only didn't have SEs ready, but you have applause ready?
This means you are forcefully required to laugh and clap.
The sound was a bit low.
Well, there is a possibility this ends today.
There's a chance this Fox Tribe Secret Meeting ends today.
But if it's well received, will it continue?
Of course, if it's well received and everyone says...
"I want to see the next one" or "I want you to do it again"...
Anyway, for this late-night radio-style program—not sure if it's chill or not—
We used HoloPlus to solicit things we wanted to ask everyone.
We'll announce those submissions and react to them. A classic format.
We asked for three topics this time.
First one is "Things that were better back in the day."
Things you think were better back then.
We don't know when "back then" refers to, though.
We recruited whatever "back then" means to you all.
And another one is "Too Free Haiku."
Yeah, usually it's 5-7-5, blah blah blah, but...
We asked for "This is my Haiku" regardless of rules.
And the last corner is the classic "One word for this image" caption game.
We chose one of Polka's scenes from HoloGra.
We picked a pretty recent one.
We want you to come up with lines she didn't say in the main episode.
We're planning to laugh at those submissions.
Okay, so let's start with the first corner right here.
Go ahead. "Back in the day was better..." "Back in the day was better..."
Ah, nice, nice. The echo helps.
It's too early for the elderly association meeting.
Okay, I'd like to introduce the "Back in the day was better" submissions one by one.
Okay, let's go with the first one.
The first "Back in the day was better," here it is.
"Back when I'd read the instruction manual and get excited during hours I couldn't play."
This is good. I want a voice of this as an SE.
Was it good for you too, Omaru-san?
Listen, I opened a Switch software package the other day.
I have the normal snap-case type here too, but...
I think you know what I want to say. You snap it open, right?
A wall of red. The end. Just the thing on the right. The end.
Sometimes there's a single sheet of paper on the right side.
Not even a sheet. Digitalization is advancing these days, after all.
It's all Famitsu now. Not at all.
Strategy guides... I guess I only looked at them in used book stores or something?
Like, "I feel like I've seen this before."
I still want those thick ones for collecting games or raising sims.
They sell them? For old games?
Actually, aren't you curious from which console generation manuals disappeared?
Did PlayStation 2, 3, or 4 still have them?
Hmm... I feel like the Wii still had them.
Ah, Wii. Maybe from around Wii or Wii U they were gone? Or PS3 era?
Eh, really? PS3 didn't have them?
How about PSP? Possibility they were gone.
I guess that's about right. 3DS had them apparently.
It did, it did. The square ones.
So that means those days were fun.
It was exciting. Just reading the manual.
Even though you couldn't play yet.
Some people were told "Santa will bring it."
Shall we go to the next one?
There were a lot of game-related ones, so I changed the order to ask the game ones first. Here.
"The era when the guy with a Game Boy Link Cable was a hero."
I hear this quite often during "back in the day" talks.
Wait, aren't you a bit old?
No, wait, this is definitely from the nostalgia generation.
I guess it was the nostalgia generation.
But it's true, they were heroes.
Surprisingly, parents would buy the game console...
They didn't understand "What do you use this for?" regarding the cable.
Like "Taking it to elementary school," that happened.
Well, they're at elementary school, so everyone is a friend.
But basically, "What is a Link Cable?"
"You can play games without buying that, right?"
There were parents who wouldn't buy it.
Parents who asked "What is that for?" wouldn't buy it.
So people from families with a bit of leeway bought them.
I've heard that those guys became heroes.
True. It means you needed a mother or father who understood the mechanism, allowed gaming as entertainment to an extent...
...and said "You can play with friends, go play with everyone." Otherwise it was impossible.
Also if you had siblings in the family.
Ah, yeah. "Maybe the siblings can play together," that sort of feeling.
Right, right. So getting them to understand something like a Link Cable was tricky.
After Link Cables came the infrared era?
Is that why they became unnecessary?
Eh, seriously? Shall we go to the next one?
"No matter how much I gamed, I was fine the next day. Now my eyes get dry and crusty."
No, but it might not necessarily be presbyopia.
...eyes that have been abused for years, decades...
For people who look at PCs and LCD screens.
The thick, gloopy kind is good.
Is the gloopy type good? Polka-san.
The thick ones really work for dry eyes.
Everyone, take care of your eyes.
Make days to rest your eyes properly.
And it stayed displayed at the top forever.
Like, it's just stuck up there, and it felt kinda awkward.
Why am I being told this...
Es-Pro-kun was like "I took a break now!"
True, eyes are important after all.
Following those warnings once in a while might be good.
True, "the machine wants to rest" is funny.
Does the machine want a break?
"Bringing game consoles together to play noisily with friends at the park or home."
Nowadays online has become mainstream, after all.
Of course there are functions for local play too, but...
With so many games like that, and the spread of online play...
Bringing consoles to meet friends or go to their houses has probably decreased.
Nowadays Holo-members do it too, but carrying around a Switch...
But actively taking it outside like that...
Yeah. I feel like I saw it until recently though.
Little kids gathering in the park.
"Recently" has become a very broad term for us.
The 3DS generation might feel targeted by this.
No, it's broad. Probably hits Game Boy Advance generation too.
Even now, when going out to events or into the city...
Checking how many StreetPass hits you got on 3DS...
I saw a YouTuber doing that.
Someone brought one to Expo last year or the year before and got a hit.
Isn't that crazy? Like "Woah, I passed someone!"
Hey Fubuki, let's bring ours to Expo.
Let's see how many fans we can pass at Expo.
Let's see how many people we can pass. Let's do it.
Even if we stand on stage at the aquarium event venue...
"Was it the real one?" We'll make a verification video later.
Make a video. Do it on "Po-Legend."
Eh, a Short is fine. A Short.
"Tried to see how many people we could hit."
Wow, nice. "Ah, I did this. I passed 10 people," someone says.
Heeeh. Ah, nice. Let's have Mane-chan walk around with it.
True. Having Mane-chan walk around might be a good idea.
As a project for Fox Tribe Secret Meeting.
"It's a project, please carry this," and ask them to go.
Ah, that sounds good. Have them walk around and see how many we pass.
Have the two of them walk in opposite directions.
Ah right, right. Eh, gotta get a 3DS ready.
As a project for Fox Tribe Secret Meeting Part 1.
Let's go to the next one.
Next is also a game topic.
"Before microtransactions, when games were released 100% complete." What does that mean?
People who understand that must be...
Right? Does it mean before DLC?
Is everyone okay? Is there a customer who-- this is bad.
Customer, your friend is looking for you.
"A system where you can purchase virtual goods within an online service for a small amount."
It's the era before billing services.
Right, probably games where paying extra simply didn't exist.
Probably the era of games where billing didn't exist in the first place.
"This is the complete product, there is no additional DLC," that type.
Makes you wonder if that's actually familiar to everyone.
Polka has an image of it exploding with Mario Kart.
Ah, feels like it came from Nintendo.
Yeah, Polka feels late to realize it.
I think it started a bit before that.
But I have the image that it became easier to do.
"Early elementary school, shouting anime and game move names with friends outside without shame or appearance in mind."
Fubuki, during Polka's horse racing stream the other day...
You said "This sounds like a move name, it's cool!"
I want you to keep this feeling even now.
Rather, I could only say move names like "Teyaa!" "Toryaa!"
Dragon Quest moves are fine too.
Saying "Zoom!" (Ruura) and flying off somewhere on your own.
Ah, speaking of that, you do stuff like Shoryuken.
"Dyukushi" is easy to say, but it's not really a move name.
Why is the SE for punching someone "Dyukushi"?
Well, probably because someone said it.
Eh, I get it. Speaking of which...
Polka tends to put up barriers.
Barrier! Whole Earth Barrier! No fair, no fair! Cheat, cheat!
That's an ability user. That's "Narou" genre stuff.
But I have a barrier-piercing attack.
Ah I see. Barrier Pierce! Paan! Nullify everything!
But we can still do this.
Maybe there was less shame in early elementary school.
Let's go to the next one.
This summarizes all of that. Here.
"It was better when I was a kid and could game innocently."
Like, when you're small, it's just "Let's clear the game!"
As you learn game terms and things and become an adult...
You gradually start saying "Isn't the plot kinda weak?"
Predicting things, or looking at someone's evaluation...
Some people say "This game isn't fun."
Right, right. You see that and...
You end up feeling like that.
So it's like "That game was better."
Ah, I see. You don't have that when you're a kid.
There was a comment just now: "That weapon is weak."
The time when you looked at everything through stats like weak/strong.
Of course, elementary kids might say "This is strong so I'll use it," but...
Right, right. "It's level 100 so it's the strongest."
Next... a bit different from games.
This connects to "Burst Stream of Destruction."
"Back when Yu-Gi-Oh card packs could be bought for 150 yen."
Seriously, apparently you could buy them for 150 yen.
I feel like you could buy Pokemon stickers though.
By the way, a quick search says current Yu-Gi-Oh packs are 176 yen or so.
Depending on the item? Or 198 yen.
Did the number of cards change?
I don't know... Did it go up a bit? Something like that?
10 yen... The base price is 160 yen, but with tax it becomes 176 yen.
But speaking of this, Jump. Jump magazine went up a lot.
Ah, right, true. Jump used to be like 200 yen!
Exactly. Jump is 400 or 500 yen now? I don't know, but it was expensive.
So it was an era when it cost quite a bit.
But Yu-Gi-Oh and everything, packs are getting more expensive.
In exchange, like Holo-Cards, isn't the foil wrapping super pretty?
The variety of sparkles has increased.
I think the card game industry is finding different ways to present things every year.
It's amazing for the price increase.
Such times existed. Let's move on.
"Getting game soundtracks on CD from Tsutaya or Surugaya..."
"...and importing them to a Walkman as raw audio."
Not putting it on iPod or AirPods.
Not sound source... AAC or whatever, skipping that.
Obsessive. This is real obsession. Obsessed with the source.
And importing to a Walkman back then. Walkman implies an enthusiast.
Right, properly listening on a CD component system directly.
"The era when the payout didn't stop at 2400."
I want to go to that era too.
"That there were a lot of sketchy spiritual/occult TV shows."
"Tales of the Unusual" is still on periodically.
I feel like they do it once a year.
Speaking in an urban legend style...
Maybe they stopped doing it because real ones started appearing?
Also, it's an era where fakes can be made.
YouTube has more of this stuff now.
True, YouTubers, and recently TikTokers go to haunted spots.
Recently, conversely, people who don't believe in ghosts, who aren't scared...
Say "I am the ghost," wait in ambush at haunted spots, and play scary sounds.
There was a streamer like that.
It's not good to do that in those places though.
Is it punishment for people trespassing without permission?
Apparently they wait in ruins. Scary.
Haa... people do it even if it's not allowed.
Yes, even with permission, it's not something you should do. It's terrifying.
"I feel nostalgic that there was a curfew for going home."
Somehow, even now, doesn't music play saying "Let's go home"?
Doesn't "Let's go home" play in some places?
Something like "It's time to go home, good children, let's go home."
Maybe a chime in the evening.
I feel like there was "Yuyake Koyake" too.
That was sort of a curfew.
Also, the after-school centers near schools...
They close at a certain time too.
Should we make a curfew too?
I don't want a stream curfew.
"Back when I hid under the futon playing DS."
Where was it? Was it a dark era?
I feel like there was non-backlit hardware.
If it lights up, maybe it's okay, but...
If you hide and do it, your eyes will get bad.
Either way, they always said doing it in the dark makes your eyes bad.
I wonder? Has it been proven?
"Go to sleep, don't play games," they say...
And Mom comes to check sometimes.
They get mad if you read manga or do anything late at night.
Polka is smart so I woke up at 5 AM.
Too smart. Waking up early is good.
Because I'm smart. Waking up early to play.
Those were three letters I saw for the first time.
"Recently I saw Mister Donut's Pon de Ring is 170 yen..."
"...and thought the time we could buy them at the 100 yen sale was good."
I want to buy unlimited donuts.
Is that not a thing anymore?
Rice balls got expensive too recently, right?
People are excited talking about that.
Well, donuts aren't on 100 yen sale anymore.
They don't do those sales anymore, Mister Donut.
The really good premium ones are like 200 yen?
Apple pie types were always expensive though.
I see... it got expensive. Cost of living increase.
Conversely, if you grew up with these prices...
Some might think "Eh? It was that cheap?"
A lot of people are being exposed right now.
A lot of people are saying "Ah, nostalgic."
"And the time before everyone wore spats was good."
Eh, you have swimsuits, don't you?
Yes, the era when individual 3D swimsuits existed.
Gamers have them. Gamers have them, maybe.
Gen 3 had them too I think.
So around when Gen 2 and Gamers finished.
Well, individual swimsuits for everyone existed.
It might remain. If it exists.
We danced "Shiny Smily Story" and such.
It should remain in some videos.
Well, people who can see it...
Recent people probably don't know this.
"Ah, that existed," that kind of thing.
Where were the nano-bikinis stored away?
Does it mean there were individual panties?
I guess they didn't think about it much?
Maybe not "didn't think," but maybe didn't think we'd be seen that much.
Or didn't expect such bold movements. You can feel the evolution.
Probably didn't think "it would be seen this much."
I guess standardizing was better after that. Spats and such.
"Now is fine too, but when I hear 'Kon-kon Kitsune! Fluffy tail is the real nature! Number one star in your heart! Shirakami here!' in archives..."
Do you still say this, Fubu-chan?
I might not say it much on stream.
I often say "This is Shirakami! Hi Friends!"
During sponsored stuff, I try to do the self-intro properly.
Polka knows this era, so "back then"?
But I don't do this greeting every time...
So hearing this phrase makes people happy.
Saying it alone is a bit...
It was decided during Sukon-bu recruitment.
I say it when I say it.
She says it when she wants to look cool.
I say it when I want to look cool.
Next... Next is, this one feels nice, Polka.
"For a Za-in (Polka fan), it's right now."
"The Ringmaster interacting with various Holo-members right now..."
You guys! You guys are happy!
Overwhelmingly, the one Shirakami feels strongly about is this one.
This is probably from a Heimin (Kanata fan).
The time when everyone was here...
It's lonely that it becomes a memory.
But the fact they remain as memories...
They didn't just disappear with "Forget me!"
So passing down stories is important.
As long as you don't forget...
I think they live on in everyone's hearts.
There's a famous line: "When do people die?"
As long as we don't forget, they live in our hearts.
Posting things like "I wanna see them" or "Are they doing well?"...
"Making a zoo with your own voice."
I did a gorilla via chat request...
And it became the line "I'm Amane Kanata."
I tried recording it with my own voice...
Unexpectedly, my voice sounded like Kanata.
Eh? Right, I was surprised. At first I was just imitating "She talks like this"...
But as the animal voices layered...
"Kon-Kanata! Amane Kanata! Everyone Kon-Kanata!" Or something.
I had the mysterious illusion of hearing Kanata-tan's voice.
They say you forget a person's voice first...
So the voice remaining is good.
I have no choice but to become Generic Kanata.
What kind of story is that?
I felt like I met Kanata a little.
Right, since it's recorded, it sounds like a person's voice.
If you're curious, check the archive or clips.
This is the last one for "Back in the Day."
"Something I thought while watching YouTube recently."
"Now Full HD, 1080p or 1440p streams are standard."
"I remembered being moved by the detail and realism."
"Even now if I raise quality watching videos..."
"It's different from the emotion back then."
Because now it's the era of 1080p and 4K.
Regarding video... Taking videos on phones used to be like that.
Also there was a video service called Vine.
Seeing how much you could make people laugh.
Seeing how much you could do with a small size.
But true, Full HD being normal is a strange story.
Strange story. Sometimes visiting old NicoNico videos makes you go "Oh!"
Polka released a new song that sounds nostalgic recently.
I wrote that "It's best viewed in 360p."
Shirakami lowered the quality for that Polka video only.
Even though I haven't heard it, it sounds like a song I've heard.
The protagonists appear "Fwaaa" and the boss appears "Fwa fwa fwa." It sounds like an anime song.
It sounds like one. It was mysterious.
So that was the "Back in the Day" corner.
Back in the day was good.
"Back in the day was good" but "Now is good too," right? Now?
Let's love this current era too, everyone.
True. The current self exists because of the past self.
I think we'll go through them quickly.
Well, isn't it fine? "This is okay," type.
Ah, "This kind of thing is good." Next.
"Overtime / By 11 PM / I will go home."
"Next." But they went home to watch our stream.
No! Don't scatter! Don't make it scatter! Don't scatter!
Miccorone is actually happening upstairs right now.
I wonder if she's blooming proudly.
Even though we do "Nyan-gukon" so much. Strange.
Is it like Miko-Met being business "Teetee"?
Ah, it's become a free love letter.
I'll go to the depths of Amazon to find Loli-live.
Maybe Lolis will come on "Good Brother Day" again.
Fubuki, today is "Good Brother Day" so *Ta-ta-ta!*
That's right, today is actually Good Brother Day, and also the day of Shirakami Fubuki's Solo Live.
You did it on Brother's Day?
Yes, actually, I did it on Brother's Day.
Oi oi oi oi, this is becoming a big deal.
Does that mean it's been that long since that excitement?
Yes, one year passed since the Solo Live.
Surprising, a blink of an eye.
I bought the Blu-ray in a blink of an eye.
I buy all the members' Solo Lives.
I want Polka's Solo Live Blu-ray someday too.
Not "I want a Live," but "I want the Blu-ray." First time hearing that.
"Sleep in morning / Keep sleeping / Wake up morning."
Sleeping that much is a talent.
If you can sleep that much.
"Mogami River / If I end with this / Almost Haiku."
You didn't end with it, you opened with it!
"Almost Haiku / If I end with this / Mogami River."
This Haiku didn't end with Mogami River.
Free everyone. But next is free.
Why did that get mixed in?
This is free. We wanted this. This kind of thing.
Why did Ringmaster get mixed in there?
You're not a statue or anything.
"New game / Before I knew it / 8 hours."
Ah, dragging on and on... "8 hours."
No, but if you're hooked, time flies.
"Outside cold / Monday dull / Yes I Go."
It has everything. Bon bon. This is the best.
This is good. Every day this is good. Good Monday. Narun~. Good.
"Home is good." This is fine forever.
This might be the best. "Today / Tests are over / Painting."
"Yay, tests are over." This is good.
Good job. Because you worked hard.
"Indiscriminately / Figure shelf girls / Fell to the floor. Of course."
Listen, Mens (Members). Shirakami Fubuki here. This is me, Polka. Yesterday, my shelf collapsed... seriously.
No! Polka displayed just a little bit!
Then that little shelf collapsed completely!
I'm so shocked I left it there.
Polka put plushies there, but now plushies are scattered.
It's harsh, and the plushies are pitiable...
But since I remembered it, I'll do it tonight.
Right. Please do it after this.
"Just feels like only mine is weak."
Put a flag on the ketchup rice.
We got one I really like.
With a scar on the nose, looking like a battle-hardened veteran.
True, lots of smug faces. We are being provoked in the comments.
No, maybe they don't think it's provoking. Cute, cute.
Fennec cries are kinda like "Aah!" right?
When the owner came home, it showed its belly...
Reacted to the three fennecs at the zoo.
Recently real fennecs appear on my feed.
Ah, Shizuoka! Shizuoka! Triplets were born, right?
There it is, Random Naming Championship.
What names will they get? It'd be nice if one was Polka.
Let's make them Popo, Ruru, and Kaka.
That might be cute in its own way.
Are the names decided? If not, I want one to be Polka.
One Polka? Don't make it an extra.
"Cook rice! / If not eat! / Shinji-kun! / Have to bear it!"
Even now, even now Polka sees reactions to this.
It was funny. That was funny.
Maybe that was truly late-night tension, or we were pushed to the limit.
That one, the thumbnail is super fluffy, which is good.
Fluffy but the content was steaming hot.
"I will take it back / In these 14 days."
If so, let's go for yakiniku.
"Thought of a good haiku / But / It contains unusable words."
Why did you give up there?
Had something really good in it.
That beetle is missing a line!
About 3 lines were missing from that last one.
Thank you for marking the break.
Dot, dot dot dot dot dot, read this far, dot dot dot dot dot.
Properly... Dot dot dot dot dot, read this far, dot dot dot dot dot.
Dot dot dot... dot dot dot.
Well, this is our ultimate form.
I was gonna shake hands, but...
Bath bath bath, don't bath-cancel please.
No, bath is fine. Bath is fine, it's okay.
It's not okay, please take a bath.
"Smug face" was popular in the comments.
True, everyone's curious, and you can draw it instantly.
Visualize this sometime. Fubuki doesn't know what it looks like.
Will you draw it? Or have everyone draw it.
I want you to explain what kind of smug face it is imaginatively.
True, I want an explanation. I want you to draw it.
The day you give or get chocolates?
Apparently a day for giving and receiving.
For us, nothing, rather we receive.
So, a day where chocolate is amazing.
Yes, it passed so happy birthday.
Cute. Is Shirakami okay? Our Flare will be eaten.
They are made of sugar sculpture.
Hypothetically if you're told "Including Choco-sen, take any of these 6"...
I'll take Aki-roze. Aki-roze might be good.
Eating while making one disappear side by side.
Ah, true. Like eating the pointy part of a Santa.
This hair ornament part is thin so it's easy to eat.
I want to snap the katana part.
Today's last corner is "Caption this Image."
What kind of image was it?
This is a scene that actually existed in HoloGra.
I happened to find this Polka in the Sue episode...
I was looking for an episode with Polka...
And this one happened to be there.
So let's see what this Polka is saying.
I'll have Polka read this one.
Card Shop Simulation. If so, that's super annoying.
"If you weren't here I could've left earlier."
Probably really wanted to go home.
This is dubbing an Evangelion scene.
Right, there's two stages after this.
Let's go to the next one.
No one mentions what's on the back.
No one touches it. Can't see it.
Kanata is being made fun of even here.
Kanata is a joke today too.
I wonder if they're a Ninja?
It is attached to the arm after all.
Let's go to the next one. Here.
"I told you the gym is continuing!"
"No matter how many times I say it, everyone doesn't get it."
Someone must have told her this.
No matter how much I say "I'm continuing," it doesn't sink in.
Can't be helped. I feel like the whole country is asking me.
So I'm saying it like I'm provoked.
"I don't know baseball rules, but the ball is heavy."
"A dream... of the type with pain perception."
Polka who realized it was a dream.
Have you forgotten an errand? By the way.
Even if I did, was I asked to run errands?
First Errand or something? When small?
What I, Shirakami, remember is... Elementary school...
When I could ride a bike with training wheels?
"Buy a bento at the nearby convenience store."
I think the bike was brand new.
I was happy just to ride the bike.
But the road was gravel since it was the countryside.
Gravel road, bike went "Gata gata gata gata."
Dad put on the training wheels, but...
He was loose with tightening the bolts.
Didn't buy it. Was on the way to buy it.
Rather than forgetting the errand, didn't want to go anymore.
Good girl going on an errand properly.
Shirakami back then was a good girl.
I thought this was a great combo.
There were a lot of Polkas saying "Fwaa."
"...You have blue nori on your teeth."
"You have blue nori on your teeth."
I'll say it no matter who it is!
I'll say it! No matter who has it!
Will you teach her quietly? Or pretty much...
Well if no one is around.
If other people are around, maybe not.
You end up showing it off alone.
Being exposed to the public eye.
True, if it's just the two of us, maybe.
Comment: "No one saw Polka after that."
For that Polka, here's a perfect one.
"Eh? Is there an insurance I can enter from here?"
Is there really an insurance I can enter from here?
Today is a bad luck day.
"I replaced it all with salmon furikake."
It won't come out. In the first place.
What happened to the shichimi inside?
Ah, right right. The shouting one.
Right, right. Shouting from the school roof.
That sounds like a HoloGra episode.
YAGOO is rumored to be the 8th generation actually.
So YAGOO is actually Mech YAGOO now.
Ah, as expected. He is a Mech.
Right. The real YAGOO is sitting in a really high place...
But that kind of thing usually means...
The real YAGOO body is gone and only the brain remains. Scary type.
Bad bad bad, don't erase YAGOO.
So in these times, you name yourself.
"Long time no see, it's Polka! Remember?"
If they still don't say it, it's over.
